subject: Ethics
title: The Prisoner's Dilemma
description: A 60-second lesson on The Prisoner's Dilemma.

hook.text: Two criminals are arrested. If both stay silent, they go free. But betraying the other is so tempting.

buildup.text: Each prisoner faces a choice: cooperate with their partner or betray them for a lighter sentence.

discovery.text: The rational move is always to betray. But if both betray, both get worse outcomes than if both cooperated.

twist.text: In repeated games, the winning strategy is 'tit for tat'â€”cooperate first, then mirror what the other does.

climax.text: The dilemma shows why trust is fragile: selfishness is rational, but mutual cooperation beats mutual betrayal.

punchline.text: Trust pays offâ€”but only if the other person trusts back.
